CatDescriptText: Mary Jane Hairston, 538 W. Jefferson Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 8, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that discrimination and segregation exist in Pittsburgh public school system?" Answer reads: "I really do think there is some.  However, I can only judge by the schools which my children attend.  I don't think there is too much."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Jane Hairston standing with hands clasped together in front of block building with sign with Marlin
